course.title: Reinventing Literary China: Old Tales Retold in Modern Times
course.meeting_text: M., W., at 11, and a weekly section to be arranged.
course.faculty_text: David Der-Wei Wang (East Asian Languages and Civilizations) and Wai-yee Li (East Asian Languages and Civilizations)
course.description: What makes a story prevail through time? We will visit the most beloved, enduring works in the Chinese tradition and discover cultural icons from the Handsome Monkey King to the Nobel prize-winning novel Soul Mountain. We will explore the cultural trends and themes that have been the stuff of popular Chinese novels, TV, cinema, and thought. This course offers a comprehensive, yet unique and unconventional window into Chinese tradition and modernity, past and present.
course.notes: No previous knowledge of Chinese required. This course fulfills the requirement that one of the eight General Education courses also engage substantially with Study of the Past.
